welcome: ğŸ‘‹ Hello, {name}! Welcome to the Crypto Word Game. This is a word guessing game with a cryptographic twist. What is Cryptography? Simply put, it's the art of 'encoding' messages. In this game, every letter is encoded into a number based on a secret key or 'shift'. How does the game work? We use a classic method called the Caesar Cipher. Normally, A=1, B=2, etc. But with a 'shift', the key can change, for example, A might become 2 or 3! Your task is to guess the hidden letters based on these numeric clues. Type /crypto to start your first game, or /help if you need guidance.

help_text_whatiscrypto: ğŸ“– What is Cryptography & Caesar Cipher? Cryptography is the science of hiding information. We use a cipher (a set of rules) to turn readable text into a secret code. This game uses the Caesar Cipher, one of the oldest ciphers. It works by 'shifting' the alphabet. For example, with a shift of 1: A becomes B (value 2) B becomes C (value 3) ... Each puzzle in this bot can have a different shift, making it more challenging!
